Title: Reliability Engineer
Job_Description:
SCOPE:
The Reliability Engineer is responsible for driving continuous improvements to equipment reliability by providing and coordinating technical support and implementing the reliability improvement processes for the facility. The primary role of the Reliability Engineer is to identify and manage asset reliability risks that could adversely affect plant or business operations. This candidate will have the goal of reducing the downtime and equipment failure risk levels to the business and will directly report to the Engineering Leader in the Engineering Site Maintenance (ESM) – Business Unit.
The Reliability Engineer will provide expertise and leadership for key equipment assets ensuring reliability is maintained at the highest levels; and will drive for increased reliability of work processes, procedures and operating practices.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND JOB DUTIES:
Assist in the development and implementation of a comprehensive Reliability Centered Maintenance strategy for the plant, based upon business needs.
Provide support and leadership around Plant wide Business Continuity efforts to allow for the continued delivery of products and services at acceptable predefined levels following a disruptive event.
Provide support and follow up with Business Unit resources to effectively track critical spares items (with zero on hand quantity) that make the plant wide Level 1 - Priority Spares list, and assist with developing mitigation plans to reduce exposures and risks around this assets in service.
Identify and assist in the implementation of best practices related to reliability improvements across the site that continuously strive to achieve World Class levels.
Guide efforts to ensure reliability and maintainability of equipment, processes, utilities, facilities and plant assets.
Apply appropriate reliability tools to drive improvements, optimize costs, and improve asset effectiveness (i.e., Pareto Analysis, FMEA, Criticality Analysis, RCM, Reliability Roadmap, etc.).
Monitor and compile Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reliability metrics for proactive identification and resolution of reliability issues.
Tracks production losses and abnormally high maintenance cost assets to find ways to reduce those losses or high costs through root cause analysis, data trending, and facilitates implementation.
Lead Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFAs) and corrective actions for complex and/or repetitive problems that lead to unplanned downtime events. Participate in reliability related incident investigations; prioritize action items, establish single point accountability (SPA) and follow-up on their implementation as part of maintaining the Plant wide RCA list.
Identify, develop and help implement engineered improvements and solutions for chronic or repetitive issues.
Improve overall plant reliability through PM effectiveness tracking, corrective work orders and PM process improvements through PM optimization efforts.
Development of critical equipment list and critical spare parts inventory that fits into the LRPP (Logan Risk Prioritization Process) model as new assets and equipment are commissioned into the facility.
Provides input to a risk management plan that will anticipate reliability-related and non-reliability related risks that could adversely impact plant operations.
Support capital projects by supplying historical data, cost analysis, or other information related to reliability during scope development.
Works with an Engineering / Cross-Functional Team to ensure the reliability and maintainability of owned assets.
Participates in the development of design and installation specifications along with commissioning plans for new assets to ensure that reliability considerations are being included.
Participates in the final check-out of new installations to assure adherence to functional specifications.
QUALIFICATIONS:
The candidate must possess the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization in both written and oral form. Practices active listening. Communicates openly and shares information with others, as appropriate.
He or she should also possess strong and advanced computer skills utilizing Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, etc.) with demonstrated experience and good working knowledge with a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS), preferably using TabWare. Drafting and CAD / 3D Modeling experience a plus.
The passion to exist in a dynamic environment that has a continuous improvement focus.
Having any of the following certifications is considered a plus: CMRP (Certified Maintenance Reliability Professional), CRL (Certified Reliability Leader), CRE (Certified Reliability Engineer), Six Sigma / Lean Manufacturing (i.e. White Belt, Yellow Belt, Green Belt, Brown Belt, Black Belt, etc.)
Experience and demonstrated knowledge with predictive / preventative maintenance (PdM) technologies with the capability to effectively interpret results from data obtained using Vibration Analysis, Balancing, Infrared / Thermography, Ultrasound, Condition Monitoring, Oil Analysis, Lubrication Best Practices, Nondestructive Testing (NDT), Precision Alignment / Precision Maintenance, Motor Circuit Analysis, Failure Analysis and Motion Amplification Camera technology.
Troubleshooting, root cause analysis, inspection and final acceptance testing experience desired.
Ability to understand and clearly explain complicated concepts and processes.
Proven ability to be an effective teacher and comfortable leading group discussion and presenting material in front of peers, teams and co-workers in a group or classroom setting.
Be flexible and available to interact and connect with people at all levels in the organization.
Be self-directed and highly motivated.
Demonstrate proven organizational skills and ability to prioritize, while being detail oriented and able to meet deadlines.
Display the ability to multi-task and be effective in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Proven ability to collaborate and work closely with cross-functional teams.
Ability to effectively read and interpret drawings and blueprints.
Bachelor's Degree in an Engineering discipline (preferably Mechanical or Electrical Engineering), with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience
An understanding of best practices for maintenance processes; including, but not limited to Risk Based assessment, Total Productive Maintenance, Design for Reliability, Design for Operability, Design for Maintainability and Reliability Based Inspections is also an important asset for this po

Job_Description:
Description
How would you like to improve machinery and process systems? We want entry level engineers who can handle dynamic work environments and who know how to think outside of the box. We rely on our engineers in manufacturing and our physical distribution centers to make our products to the highest of standards. If you would like to be a part of this process, then we want you to apply!
Are you ready for the challenge?
Meaningful work on Day 1
We produce high-quality products and need to do so on-time and at a low cost. We value your creativity and skill in analyzing and solving some big, meaningful problems. From the beginning, you will be leading projects that matter and guiding teams that will impact the production of globally recognized branded products. Our manufacturing process engineers help us get things done!
We offer you:
An impactful career path, with meaningful work from the beginning
Continuous mentorship, coaching, training, and guidance
The opportunity to learn and work with the world-renowned technologies
The chance to influence the production and quality of our leading products
A diverse, multifaceted work environment passionate about safety and quality
We are seeking individuals with the following qualities:
The ability to problem solve and collaborate in teams
Highly motivated, self-driven, and eager to learn new skills
Strong communication, interpersonal, time management, and analytical skills
A desire to work in a fast-paced, hands-on manufacturing environment with technicians and equipment
What will you do?
Where you work depends on a number of things. Manufacturing Process Engineers lead our efforts to identify and drive out losses through standards and system development. They support the daily activities of the production line and/or processing areas, and build long term capability into their area, systems, and technicians. Daily work could encompass any of the following:
Identifying, prioritizing, analyzing, and eliminating losses and inefficiencies
Delivery and start-up of new equipment, initiatives, and projects
Collaborating with technical experts, other functions, and other manufacturing sites to create the best solutions
Creating learning programs and coaching and training technicians
Creating and improving standards to enable us to achieve the performance targets for the production line
Understanding and working with state-of-the-art robotics and automated equipment
We have plants all over the region, and where you go is based on your skills and interests as well as our business need. With this Engineer role, you may work in either of these areas:
Manufacturing (Making, Packing, Safety, or Health Safety & Environment)
Physical Distribution Centers and/or Warehouse

Qualifications

You are a good fit here if you:
Have a BS/MS degree in engineering. We prefer Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial, Chemical Engineering, though we may also consider other engineering.

Avanti Battery Company is a battery storage startup commercializing a new battery chemistry recently discovered at MIT. We have supportive investors and a clear runway to design, test, innovate, and create. The founders of Avanti are inventors and entrepreneurs with extensive experience at successful climate tech and battery startups. You will work at our headquarters in Watertown, MA, where you will apply your technical expertise to challenging problems and exciting hardware development. We are breaking new ground in the realm of battery storage and your contributions will be an essential part of that adventure. Overall, we are searching for engineers with the flexibility, curiosity and proactiveness to embrace life at a hardware start-up while developing cutting edge new batteries.

Your role will impact every facet of our product. You will focus on mechanical design and material selection for our battery cells to actively improve cell durability, cost-effectiveness and energy efficiency. Engineers and scientists are the heart of our company, and you will be joining a supportive environment that encourages your own career growth and professional development. This is an opportunity to have a direct and daily impact in an exciting energy technology startup.

Our engineers have primary responsibility for conducting innovative experiments, expanding our work into new research areas, and applying their expertise to the creation of a new battery storage product. This is an exciting time at our company, and we are looking for engineers who can direct that feeling towards every aspect of product development!

Build better batteries every day

Identify equipment/resource constraints, place orders as required, and expand our internal technical capabilities

Uphold lab and chemical safety standards

A mechanical engineering degree

Peak Design has traditionally made both hard goods and soft goods (think tripods and backpacks). In 2021, we made our first foray into electronics when we released a revolutionary line of mobile phone cases and mounting solutions that we call, simply, Mobile.

This is an engineering role focused on mechanical development and testing of new products in this exciting new line. Day to day, you will own the mechanical development of new and existing products on our fast-paced and ever-changing roadmap. This will include:

Establishing design requirements. Market research for new product definition. Ideation of new product concepts.
Partnering with the Industrial Design team on ID directions and implementing them in a parametric CAD stack.
Formulating and documenting test procedures for products in development.
Management and organization of proto and EVT builds.
Building proficiency in Onshape and establishing a clear organizational structure for new and old CAD.
Guide outsourced CAD resources in China for latter stage design.

ABOUT YOU

The following list represents a range of traits and experience that would help make you highly effective and impactful in this role:

Strong technical aptitude. You lean into technical challenges and are able and excited to go deep on a technical topic to build your knowledge.
Experience owning mechanical parts and assemblies from prototyping through mass production for high volume products that have successfully shipped to customers.
Highly effective at creating and maintaining complex 3D models in any major 3D CAD system. Bonus points for direct Onshape experience (we recently transitioned from Solidworks to Onshape).
Strong desire and inclination toward hands-on prototyping. You love to create actual functioning prototypes and products, not just design them virtually.
Strong mechanical aptitude, both hands-on and theoretical. You’ve worked extensively with moving parts and mechanisms.
Deep familiarity with a few (or all) of the following manufacturing processes: CNC milling, die casting, injection molding, stamping, extrusion, and assembly.
Familiarity with various surface finishes: anodization, powder coating, painting, plating. Familiarity with basic materials properties: aluminum alloys, steels, rubbers, plastics.
Familiarity with phase-gates manufacturing system (Proto, EVT, DVT, PVT, Mass Production).Previous travel to China and vendor management - experience bringing up a manufacturing line and problem solving in-person from EVT through MP.
Working knowledge of supply chain structure and ability to navigate communication at various levels of the supply chain.

You hold an undergraduate or graduate degree in Mechanical Engineering, Product Design, or comparable degree or experience.
You have 3+ years of post grad work experience doing some form of mechanical design.You’re able to travel to China or other parts of Asia to visit our suppliers 1-3 times per year.

NOT REQUIRED, BUT ALWAYS VALUED:

You use and care a lot about gear (photography, outdoor, or other passion areas).
You have strong opinions about the products that you use in your life and enjoy debating what makes these products great.
You’re a systems thinker and love optimizing workflow and efficiency - you are capable of navigating surprise roadblocks with rational thinking and problem solving.

If you prefer to work in a more traditional corporate environment, Peak Design might not be the place for you. But if you’re pickin’ up what we’re putting down, we look forward to hearing from you!

Company Overview:
Relativity is the first and only company to automate aerospace manufacturing by integrating intelligent robotics, software, and proprietary metal 3D printing technology. Disrupting 60 years of aerospace, Relativity offers a radically simplified supply chain, building a rocket with 100x fewer parts in less than 60 days. Team:
The Stennis team at Relativity Space is responsible for designing, building, and operating world-class test stands to support the Terran 1 and Terran R stages, engines, and propulsion components. As part of this team, you will help build and operate massive outdoor test stands at the historic Stennis Space Center on the Gulf Coast, the largest rocket engine test complex in the country. Unique to this location, you will have the opportunity to get hands-on the fully integrated engine and stage assemblies, push the hardware to the limits, and witness rocket engines firing up close and personal! This team is critical to the launch success of Terran 1, continued development of Terran R, among many other firsts! Check out this video to learn more about the Stennis test team.
What you’ll do:
As an entry level Propulsion Test Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and operating rocket engine test stands for our Terran 1 and Terran R engines and stages. Entry level engineers at our Stennis facility work in partnership with experienced operations and ground systems engineers and technicians to build and modify test facilities, as well as participate in test campaigns to flight qualify our hardware. You will be directly engaged in daily test operations, maintenance, construction, and commissioning activities in the field. The entry level role may include aspects of both designing ground systems [Design focus] and conducting test operations [Operations focus].
[Design focus]
Design advanced propulsion test stands including 3D modeling, fluids, structural, and thermal analysis, fabrication drawings, fluids P&IDs, component lists, and detailed work instructions
Supervise the construction, commissioning, and initial operations of these facilities
Solve a variety of technical problems, across broad ranges of timeframe, complexity, cost, and long-term impact
Support operations on and perform related improvements to existing test stands
[Operations focus]
Create, modify, and optimize test sequences, procedures, and data review processes
Conduct complex propulsion test operations to assess performance of rocket engines and stages
Directly control and receive telemetry from the test stand and test articles through GUIs and an integrated software suite for control, automation, and data visualization
Help develop new rocket engine propulsion designs based on real test data
Potentially travel to production and launch locations, up to 25%
